conciliation and arbitration act 1904 (cth), s. 119(3). sawmill workers who performed all their work at the sawmill, supplied no tools themselves but had all the raw materials and equipment supplied to them, who did not perform work for any other person, and who were subject to instructions as to the actual method of performing the work and who were each a part of the organisation of the sawmill were employees.
